snippet: A federal judge in California dismissed a lawsuit brought by soccer players and parents seeking to force FIFA and other governing bodies to change the sport’s rules to limit the risk of concussions.
abstract: United States District Court Judge Phyllis Hamilton dismisses lawsuit brought by players and parents seeking to force governing bodies of soccer, including FIFA, to change rules of game to make head injuries and concussions less likely.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in California dismissed a lawsuit brought by soccer players and parents seeking to force FIFA and other governing bodies to change the sport’s rules to limit the risk of concussions.
